{{cpp/title|boolalpha|noboolalpha}}
{{cpp/io/manip/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|ios}}
{{dcl|num=1|
std::ios_base&amp; boolalpha( std::ios_base&amp; str );
}}
{{dcl|num=2|
std::ios_base&amp; noboolalpha( std::ios_base&amp; str );
}}
{{dcl end}}

@1@ Enables the {{tt|boolalpha}} flag in the stream {{c|str}} as if by calling {{c|str.setf(std::ios_base::boolalpha)}}.

@2@ Disables the {{tt|boolalpha}} flag in the stream {{c|str}} as if by calling {{c|str.unsetf(std::ios_base::boolalpha)}}.

{{tt|std::boolalpha}} is an I/O manipulator, so it may be called with an expression such as {{c|out &lt;&lt; std::boolalpha}} for any {{tt|out}} of type {{lc|std::basic_ostream}} or with an expression such as {{c|in &gt;&gt; std::boolalpha}} for any {{tt|in}} of type {{lc|std::basic_istream}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|str|reference to I/O stream}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{c|str}} (reference to the stream after manipulation).

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;sstream&gt;

int main()
{
    // boolalpha output
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "default true: " &lt;&lt; true &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "default false: " &lt;&lt; false &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; std::boolalpha 
              &lt;&lt; "boolalpha true: " &lt;&lt; true &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "boolalpha false: " &lt;&lt; false &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; std::noboolalpha 
              &lt;&lt; "noboolalpha true: " &lt;&lt; true &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "noboolalpha false: " &lt;&lt; false &lt;&lt; '\n';

    // boolalpha parse
    bool b1, b2;
    std::istringstream is("true false");
    is &gt;&gt; std::boolalpha &gt;&gt; b1 &gt;&gt; b2;

    std::cout &lt;&lt; '"' &lt;&lt; is.str() &lt;&lt; "\" parsed as: "
              &lt;&lt; std::boolalpha &lt;&lt; b1 &lt;&lt; ' ' &lt;&lt; b2 &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
default true: 1
default false: 0
boolalpha true: true
boolalpha false: false
noboolalpha true: 1
noboolalpha false: 0
"true false" parsed as: true false
}}
